00021 #ifndef CCN_SyncRoot
00022 #define CCN_SyncRoot
00023 
00024 #include <ccn/ccn.h>
00025 
00026 struct SyncHashCacheHead;  // defined in SyncHashCache.h
00027 struct SyncNameAccum;      // defined in SyncUtil.h
00028 struct SyncBaseStruct;     // defined in SyncBase.h
00029 struct SyncRootPrivate;    // private to SyncRoot.c
00030 
00031 /**
00032  * A SyncRootStruct object holds the necessary data for a root sync tree.
00033  */
00034 struct SyncRootStruct {
00035     unsigned rootId;                      /**< root Id for reporting */
00036     struct SyncBaseStruct *base;          /**< Sync Agent base */
00037     struct SyncRootStruct *next;          /**< next root in our list */
00038     struct SyncRootPrivate *priv;         /**< private to SyncRoot */
00039     struct SyncHashCacheHead *ch;         /**< cache head */
00040     struct ccn_charbuf *topoPrefix;       /**< Sync Protocol topo prefix */
00041     struct ccn_charbuf *namingPrefix;     /**< Sync Protocol naming prefix */
00042     struct SyncNameAccum *filter;         /**< filter clauses */
00043     struct ccn_charbuf *currentHash;      /**< current top-level cache hash */
00044     struct SyncNameAccum *namesToAdd;     /**< names needing addition to root */
00045     struct SyncNameAccum *namesToFetch;   /**< names needing contents fetch */
00046     void *actions;                        /**< data for pending interests */
00047     void *compare;                        /**< data for doing sync tree comparison */
00048     void *update;                         /**< data for doing sync tree updates */
00049     struct ccn_charbuf *sliceCoding;      /**< ccnb encoding for the description */
00050     struct ccn_charbuf *sliceHash;        /**< the raw hash of the sliceCoding */
00051 };
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * namesToAdd has the names where content is known to be present.  These names
00055  * should come from SyncNotifyContent.
00056  * The name storage belongs to the root.
00057  *
00058  * namesToFetch has the names where content should be fetched.  Once content is
00059  * fetched and stored to the repo the names should be appended to namesToAdd.
00060  * The name storage belongs to the root.
00061  */
00062 
00063 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00064 // Routines for working with sync tree roots
00065 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00066 
00067 /**
00068  * Creates a new root structure and adds it to the base.
00069  * The syncScope will be used for sync control interests (-1 for unscoped).
00070  * The topoPrefix and namingPrefix will be copied and canonicalized.
00071  * The filter (and the names in it) will also be copied and canonicalized.
00072  * Canonicalized data is owned by the base.
00073  * @returns the new root object
00074  */
00075 struct SyncRootStruct *
00076 SyncAddRoot(struct SyncBaseStruct *base,
00077             int syncScope,
00078             const struct ccn_charbuf *topoPrefix,
00079             const struct ccn_charbuf *namingPrefix,
00080             struct SyncNameAccum *filter);
00081 
00082 /**
00083  * Removes the root from the base, and frees up associated storage.
00084  * Requires that there are no active comparisons.
00085  * Deactivates all pending interests.
00086  * @returns NULL if the root was removed, the root itself if not removed.
00087  */
00088 struct SyncRootStruct *
00089 SyncRemRoot(struct SyncRootStruct *root);
00090 
00091 /**
00092  * Parse a content object representing a config slice,
00093  * and if successful add it to the base.
00094  * @returns the new root if successful, NULL otherwise.
00095  */
00096 struct SyncRootStruct *
00097 SyncRootDecodeAndAdd(struct SyncBaseStruct *base,
00098                      struct ccn_buf_decoder *d);
00099 
00100 /**
00101  * Appends the ccnb encoding for a config slice to the provided cb.
00102  * @returns -1 for failure, 0 for success.
00103  */
00104 int
00105 SyncRootAppendSlice(struct ccn_charbuf *cd, struct SyncRootStruct *root);
00106 
00107 enum SyncRootLookupCode {
00108     SyncRootLookupCode_none,        /**< not covered by this root */
00109     SyncRootLookupCode_covered,     /**< covered by this root */
00110     SyncRootLookupCode_error        /**< error in the name or the state */
00111 };
00112     
00113 /**
00114  * @returns the top entry, if the root hash has been established for this root,
00115  * otherwise returns NULL.
00116  */
00117 struct SyncHashCacheEntry *
00118 SyncRootTopEntry(struct SyncRootStruct *root);
00119 
00120 /**
00121  * Tests to see if the name is covered by this root.
00122  * Useful for testing full names given by the Repo.
00123  * The topoPrefix does not participate, but the filter does.
00124  * @returns a code indicating the result
00125  */
00126 enum SyncRootLookupCode
00127 SyncRootLookupName(struct SyncRootStruct *root,
00128                     const struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00129 
00130 #endif
